ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: plsdepot contains different methods for PLS analysis of one or two data tables such as Tucker's Inter-Battery, NIPALS, SIMPLS, SIMPLS-CA, PLS Regression, and PLS Canonical Analysis. The main reference for this software is the awesome book (in French) 'La Regression PLS: Theorie et Pratique' by Michel Tenenhaus.

plsdepot contains different methods for PLS analysis of one or two data tables such as Tucker's Inter-Battery, NIPALS, SIMPLS, SIMPLS-CA, PLS Regression, and PLS Canonical Analysis. The main reference for this software is the awesome book (in French) 'La Regression PLS: Theorie et Pratique' by Michel Tenenhaus.

name: r-plsdepot
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-plsdepot
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/plsdepot_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/plsdepot/plsdepot_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b0b4d8dbdcefc6f37a0fcc35008ff2cca0309f5671dc7ad5b3b2997a98615be7

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('plsdepot')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('plsdepot')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://www.gastonsanchez.com/plsdepot, http://www.plsmodeling.com
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: "plsdepot contains different methods for PLS analysis of one or two data tables such as Tucker's Inter-Battery, NIPALS, SIMPLS, SIMPLS-CA, PLS Regression, and PLS Canonical Analysis. The main reference for this software is the awesome book (in French) 'La Regression PLS: Theorie et Pratique' by Michel Tenenhaus."
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: plsdepot
# Type: Package
# Title: Partial Least Squares (PLS) Data Analysis Methods
# Version: 0.1.17
# Date: 2012-11-12
# Authors@R: person("Gaston", "Sanchez", role=c("aut", "cre"), email = "gaston.stat@gmail.com")
# Author: Gaston Sanchez
# Maintainer: Gaston Sanchez <gaston.stat@gmail.com>
# Description: plsdepot contains different methods for PLS analysis of one or two data tables such as Tucker's Inter-Battery, NIPALS, SIMPLS, SIMPLS-CA, PLS Regression, and PLS Canonical Analysis. The main reference for this software is the awesome book (in French) 'La Regression PLS: Theorie et Pratique' by Michel Tenenhaus.
# URL: http://www.gastonsanchez.com/plsdepot, http://www.plsmodeling.com
# Depends: R (>= 2.15.1)
# Suggests: FactoMineR, plspm
